intro: Thyrsanthus luschnathii, commonly known as the Luschnath's thyrsanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters called thyrses. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
